title: Why don't people actually care to play as a team?
body: I just don't understand why most of my pings go completely ignored by people?(literally upward of 80% I swear) I play jungle, part of my role is to keep track of the enemy jungler, I ping where I think he is. I also ping lane roams and objectives, I get harassed for seeing tower opportunity and helping push the wave and killing it, I get ignored when being invaded at a bad time by the enemy jungle that should result in a free kill for us or invading at a good time that should be a free kill/free exp and gold steal for us. I can't question people in or after the game because they just default to calling me toxic, trolling or harassing and that just frustrates me to the point of actually being toxic so I am asking here. Why do most of you refuse to play as a team? I feel like people don't identify things within the game and play accordingly even when someone else on their team identifies it and communicates it. It's like hardly anyone actually wants to try.. somehow in top 5% of players on this server and everyone is basically still low silver level, probably why our competitive scene is a joke compared to other regions whose competitive scenes are still somewhat jokes compared to the best teams in the world.

replies.body:
A lot of what you are describing comes down to a toxic "I must carry" mindset. Many players don't care to trust their teammates and go about games as if they are the only player that will matter. If they don't do well, game is over so they might as well give up. 

Due to this "me me me" tunnel vision, a lot of players tend to focus on their own mechanics and their own area of the map as opposed to taking into consideration the rest of the people in the game and working as a team. Due to people being able to mute pings now, I have found people use the feature quite liberally even when the pings are used effectively for communication instead of BM. Quite a few people also /mute all in chat as soon as they get in so they don't get distracted or tilted. 

While questioning players might seem like a way for you to understand their intent, you must realize that dwelling on mistakes is only going to make the players in your game more stressed and more likely to screw up. Usually when they mess up (especially in plat) people know they did and don''t need others questioning them. 
A big example of this is when in pro matches people make bad calls, their team doesn't question them in the moment, they do it after game. In the moment they are instead thinking ahead, figuring out what they can do next. 

Also take into consideration how the players in your game got to where they are. With the current state of gameplay it is easy enough to climb to plat based on mechanics alone. If you are a mechanical god and only have moderate game knowledge (basic counter builds, how to freeze a wave, which objectives are most valuable), it can be done with enough grinding.  Mid plat+ is where macro knowledge is truly tested and starts to develop, a lot of players here will be hardstuck as they are unable to overcome this hurdle without taking time out and spending effort. 

- [Insight to soloq mentality](https://dotesports.com/league-of-legends/some-insight-on-the-mentality-of-solo-queue-players-7484)
- [soloq needs to die](http://splitpush.net/articles/lol/opinion/one-man-army-solo-queue-needs-die/)

The only way past these issues are to focus on your own gameplay and knowledge, finding a way that works for you to lead a non-communicative team and/or to pick up a solid duo. Working alongside someone else stable that you are able to voice com with that has similar goals is an invaluable resource you should never look past if you are stuck in soloq.

I appreciate this reply and while I am climbing and feel as though I can continue to climb it feels frustrating or lackluster, half of my wins feel like we didn't play the game properly or well together. Even someone who has a really good KDA I feel like can be lacking a lot sometimes - all applies to myself aswell. Have to say I feel like I'm aligned with that second link.

I may not be in the top 5%, but what I do is type "*name of jgler* top side" or mid or bot side, whenever a ward catches them, or I know they're aren't in one place (i.e. when I'm their top jungle with everything still spawned), or sometimes if they've backed and I know they just cleared bot-side and top is very pushed. *This seems to work, since my team play safer or back off*.

Also, when I go for a tower after a gank, I spam ping it and, if the laner makes no effort to help me push and take tower, I tax and push the lane myself and get the tower anyway.
